thread.title: Bob Costas will no longer host Olympics, 'SNF' for NBC
thread.title_full: Bob Costas will no longer host Olympics, 'SNF' for NBC - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Bob Costas will no longer host Olympics, 'SNF' for NBC
text:
Bob Costas is passing his Olympic broadcasting torch to Mike Tirico.
Costas, the decorated and longtime face of NBC Sports, made the announcement Thursday morning on NBC’s “Today” show that he will no longer anchor the network’s primetime coverage of the Olympics.
"I am going to be like the rest of the country, watching Mike Tirico, who will be an able successor in Korea for the Winter Olympics,” Costas said on the broadcast .
Tirico, who attended Syracuse University on the first Bob Costas scholarship at the school, joined NBC Sports last year and was perceived as Costas’ natural successor on the Olympics and a number of other shows.
Appreciating Bob Costas, NBC’s most punchable personality 
According to Sports Business Journal , Costas is also stepping aside from his role as the pregame host of “Sunday Night Football” but will maintain his post with Triple Crown races and pitch in during the NFL playoffs.
“It has been both a privilege and an incredible personal and professional experience to have been part of NBC’s Olympic coverage all these years,” Costas said in a press release.
The 65-year-old Costas has been a part of NBC’s Olympics coverage since 1988. He joined the network 37 years ago.
In addition to the NFL playoffs and the Triple Crown, Costas will have a role in other programming with NBC.
“They’ve been kind enough to call it the Brokaw phase of my career,” he said on “Today,” referencing the legendary NBC newsman Tom Brokaw who still has a presence there.
“So I’ll be to sports what Tom has been for the last several years to news. I’ll show up when it’s appropriate for me to show up, including sometimes on the Olympics or the Kentucky Derby or the Super Bowl. Or on this show.”
The 2018 Winter Olympics from PyeongChang opens one year from today.
